data.title: output channel does not auto scroll with append()
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. use `outputChannel.append(msg)` to append content to an output channel.
2. after many `append(msg)` calls, observe that the output channel window does not auto scroll.

```
var channel = vscode.window.createOutputChannel("scrolling");
channel.show();

vscode.commands.registerCommand('extension.sayHello', function () {
    // run this many times
    channel.append("Output channel does not auto scroll with append().");
});
```

Full example extension that reproduces the issue: https://github.com/kindohm/vs-code-output-append-no-autoscroll

*Note*: `appendLine` does not cause the issue. Only `append`.

data.title: Double clicking a file opens the editor but not the file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Double click any registered file, or try to "open with" a file in VSCode
2. VSCode opens, but does not open the file

Having the same problem, both with double-click and "Open with...", but not with "Open with Code" menu command.
Re-registering file as suggested in #13743 does not help - and probably is not relevant anyway, because the problem exists even with unregistered files.

data.title: VS Code Crashing during update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.7.0|;


---

This morning I was prompted to update VS Code. During the install/update process, the updater stopped responding while trying to 'Close Applications'. It sat there for about ~10 minutes before I force closed the process. 

I re-opened VS Code and went to Help->Check for Updates...
It checks for updates for about ~30 seconds, then VS Code completely crashes.

data.title: [monaco] bogus hover range
data.body:
A bogus hover range is selected if a hover provider does not provide a range.

This line looks bogus: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c4ed98f3de11541eebff5016fcea9daf14b07d5d/src/vs/editor/browser/standalone/standaloneLanguages.ts#L245

Should be:
```ts
value.range = new Range(position.lineNumber, word.startColumn, position.lineNumber, word.endColumn)
```
so `position.lineNumber` should be used as an end line number

data.title: Selecting from autocomplete when word is completed causes a new line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de)
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enter the code: `const meta = { id: 0 };`
2. Type `meta.id` (autocomplete shows up), press enter to select `id`

Expected
- Autocomplete to disappear without creating a new line

Actual
- Autocomplete disappear creating a new line

data.title: Go To Bracket Does Not Work With Multiple Cursors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

Create a new file and paste the following:

```
{

}

{
  
}
```

Now place the cursor behind the first "}" and then alt-click to place another cursor behind the second "}".

Now run "Go To Bracket".

**Actual Result**: Only a single cursor remains, and it is placed before the first "{".

**Expected Result**: If there are matching brackets for every cursor, I would expect the amount of cursors to remain the same (2) and each one to be place with its corresponding bracket.

(This working as expected would've been hugely helpful in some _copy-paste-adapt text_ task today.)

data.title: Format on paste trims trailing character when pasting class name in html
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:13:11.413Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |mavensmate|DavidHelmer|0.7.0| |html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0| |angular1-code-snippets|alexandersage|0.0.3| |htmltagwrap|bradgashler|0.0.3| |jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15| |vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8| |vscode-babel-coloring|dzannotti|0.0.4| |tslint|eg2|0.14.0| |Angular2|johnpapa|2.2.3| |debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1|; --- The issue I'm seeing is when I add a class name to an html element when I place the cursor at the end of the last class name and add a space when I paste the new class name the space is removed thus running the class names together and making them invalid. I've tested this with: `'editor.formatOnPaste': false` and it doesn't occur. I've only noticed it today so I suspect it is related to a recent update. I've also tested it with all my extensions turned off and it still occurs. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Enable 'format on paste' 2. Put a string in the clipboard (eg., 'large') 3. Place the cursor at the end of a class string eg., place it after 'brand' below `
` 4. Insert a space: `
` 5. Paste string 6. Result (note missing space): `
` 7. Expected result: `
`

data.title: Cannot package DEB or RPM packages using gulp scripts
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Trigger the execution of packageTask() through one of the gulp helpers (e.g. **gulp "vscode-linux-x64"**).
2. Execution will fail with "TypeError: Path must be a string."

(I have a fix already, just creating this issue to submit a PR against. If someone can confirm the issue exists on other's environments, so I know it's not just something to do with my local machine before accepting the fix it would be appreciated).

data.title: Test: copy all from debug console
data.body:
Refs: #2163

- [x] any os @weinand (macOS)
- [x] any os @aeschli

Complexity: 2

It is now possible to copy all the content from the debug console using the `Copy All` context menu action. 
* Debug some app (e.g. our smoke test), have a lot of output in the debug console (including objects which are expanded) and verify that `Copy All` action nicely copies all the content in the debug console. 
* Debug an extension, from an extension write objects and simple text using the `console.log`, make sure the `Copy All` action also nicely copies all these content

data.title: How to disable every extension, *but* my currently developed extension?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insider

Steps to Reproduce (taken from [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/blob/master/contentprovider-sample/.vscode/launch.json), but with `--disable-extensions`):

```
// .vscode/launch.json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "Launch Extension",
      "type": "extensionHost",
      "request": "launch",
      "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
      "args": [
        "--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}",
        "--disable-extensions"
      ],
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "sourceMaps": true,
      "outFiles": ["${workspaceRoot}/out/**/*.js"],
      "preLaunchTask": "npm"
    }
  ]
}
```

Is there a way to launch a Development Host for my custom extension _without_ loading any other extension? I tried it with `--disable-extensions`, but this seems to disable my custom extension which is passed in `--extensionDevelopmentPath`, too. Maybe `extensionDevelopmentPath` could have a higher priority than `--disable-extensions`?

data.title: Accessibility: NVDA reading wrong or duplicate content in editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest Insider
- OS Version: OS build 15063

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file with code in it, the type does not matter.
2. Arrow through the file at a rate of about twice per second, while NVDA is running.

Observed Behavior:
Rather than speaking the focused line, NVDA will at times read the line or even several lines above it.
Interestingly, braille output appears to work well enough.

Expected Behavior:
NVDA should speak the correct line when navigating through code, for a lot of people using screen readers do not use braille displays to compensate.

Suspected cause:
The fact that braille works well and speech does not leads me to believe it takes too long for the focused line to be visible for NVDA. I don't know enough about the VS Code internals to comment further.

data.title: VS Code keyboard shortcuts suggestion to learn
data.body: Keyboard shortcuts are central part of VS Code, there are a lot of them and I think I use only a fraction of them. It would be awesome if VS Code could suggest what shortcut should I learn, based on how I use the app with mouse. For example if  I click between editors a lot, then VS Code could somehow tell me to use `ctrl+1` and `ctrl+2`. This way I could gradually learn shortcuts that would increase my productivity the most.

data.title: Option to override globally disabled extension in workspace settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VScode currently has the option to disable an extension for certain workspaces.
However, there are extensions such as Arduino and the likes which are _very_ workspace specific and negatively impact the overall experience if enabled outside that environment.

Instead of having to manually disable those extensions for every workspace, I suggest making it possible to enable an extension for a workspace even if it is globally disabled.

The current behaviour does not allow you to enable the extension for a workspace if it is disabled globally:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2827047/26096008/0971f7fe-3a20-11e7-8592-c0f76d329119.png)

data.title: [FR] Allow augmenting existing themes/syntaxes with entries provided by an extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

My extension is for a language with lexemes that don't appear in other languages. In order to add coloring support for them I have to create a full theme and my extension users are forced to either have no coloring for these elements or have to say good bye to their beloved current theme. Instead it would be much better if I could augment the current theme (whatever it is) with additional entries from my extension's syntax definition and the colors for them. The `workbench.colorCustomizations` won't help here because it doesn't know what lexemes to color actually (in addition to the commonly used ones).

data.title: Error: The mode has failed while tokenizing the input.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (613724d43b4d50f6052bbb8007447ca96e687f26, 2017-05-16T06:10:52.652Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.1.12-94.1.8.el7uek.x86_64
- Extensions: the listing exceeds the lower minimum of browsers' URL characters limit
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit any file

You should then see an error popup, and you see this on the window gaining focus:
```
The mode has failed while tokenizing the input.
```

and in the dev console I see:

```
 /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.21' not found (required by /usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/node_modules/oniguruma/build/Release/onig_scanner.node): Error: /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.21' not found (required by /usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/node_modules/oniguruma/build/Release/onig_scanner.node)
    at process.module.(anonymous function) [as dlopen] (ELECTRON_ASAR.js:173:20)
    at Object.Module._extensions..node (module.js:598:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as .node] (ELECTRON_ASAR.js:173:20)
    at Module.load (module.js:488:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:447:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:439:3)
    at Module.require (module.js:498:17)
    at n (file:///usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/out/vs/loader.js:4:10596)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/node_modules/oniguruma/lib/oniguruma.js:4:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/node_modules/oniguruma/lib/oniguruma.js:69:4)
e.onUnexpectedError @ shell.ts:485
```

Looking at libstdc++.so.6 I don't appear to have anything higher than 3.4.19 on my Oracle Linux 7 machine.

Any suggestions on how to resolve this?
